activate_at_least_one_datasource: Activate at least one datasource above
only_display_nodes_minimum_one_connectio: Only display nodes that have at least one connection.
only_display_nodes_related_first_query: Only display nodes that are connected to nodes from the first query.
group_similar_nodes: Group similar nodes into a bigger node. Nodes that have exactly the same connections will be grouped.
label: Label
field_label_description: Select a field that will be displayed as the nodes' label on the graph.
field_image_description: Select a field with image urls to render nodes as images.
field_geo_location_description: Select a field with geo location (in the format: 52.1, 4.2) to display nodes on the map.
field_date_description: Select a field with dates/times to display nodes on the timeline.
connectors_explanation:
Select a field below to create a new connector. Connectors are used to link data together.

Example: Let's say you have two people in your datasource: John Smith and William Smith. Their last name is the same, but their first names are different.

If you create a connector for the field last_name, a square connector node will be drawn between the two round people nodes. The last_name square node Smith will connect the round nodes John Smith and William Smith.
